goal.en: 1. To increase students’ appreciation of the existentialism. 2. To improve students’ comprehension of the history of Continental European philosophy.
goal.ch: ⾃卡繆於1957年獲得諾⾙爾⽂學獎，他的作品在隔年引⼊台灣之後，寬泛意義下的存 在主義的思潮便因此傳⼊台灣，也由於他們的創作形式不拘於傳統的哲學論⽂，或以散 ⽂、或以⼩說，或以戲劇表現，因此影響的範圍不只是學院內的知識份⼦，更遍及各階 層，盛⾏⼀時，歷久不衰。 本課程將介紹四位在台灣享 有較⾼知名度的哲學家，以選擇其作品的⽅式。分別探討他 們的思想。這四位思想家將按照台灣熟悉的順序分別介紹，他們是：卡繆、卡夫卡、 沙特以及⿑克果。這些思想家所提的困惑不僅是屬於他們⾃⼰的，也可以是剛剛成年的 學⽣們的疑惑，更可以是⼀輩⼦的指引。 也由於⽂學思想需要慢讀，因此本學期各擇其代表作之⼀⼆介紹，並要求學⽣任意挑選 介紹篇章，書寫⼼得兩篇，作為整學期的作業，於期末考前發表。

content.en:
Existentialism was presented and once current in Taiwan when A. Camus won the Nobel Literature Prix in the 1960s. During this time, many existentialists were introduced to us and it seemed that everyone could talk about the meaning of existence, as well as their absurdity at work and the alienated feeling among people. Existentialism had been a symbol of depression for a while. At the end of the 1980s, existentialism seemed to be quickly replaced by other stranger thoughts. In fact, it wasn’t forgotten, but became the soil, from which writers drew their inspiration to finish their works, through which people expressed their sensations.
This semester, we will present four existentialists’ works, the forms of which are not limited to philosophical dissertation, but more than novel, Conte, and essay. Their themes include love, family, responsibility, chance, equality and justice in our society etc., by which we can reflect the questions about values, as well as our life’s choices.
